definition: to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: If you want to give more to SJ, please trust K ELFs.
sentences.chinese: 若你希望爲律政司司長付出多一點，請相信韓飯。

sentences.english: The Department of Justice on Friday ended its probe into Apple's backdating of stock options.
sentences.chinese: 律政司於週五結束了探究蘋果的追溯股票期權。

sentences.english: The Department of Justice is responsible for drafting legislation in both official languages.
sentences.chinese: 律政司負責以中英兩種法定語文草擬法例。

sentences.english: It was Microsoft in the Department of Justice's sights for antitrust issues.
sentences.chinese: 微軟一直在律政司的反壟斷視野之內。

sentences.english: But Attorney General Palmer heard the calls for action.
sentences.chinese: 但律政司帕爾默聽到行動的呼籲。

sentences.english: In just a few months, people began to lose trust in Attorney General Palmer.
sentences.chinese: 在短短几個月內，人們開始失去律政司帕爾默的信任。

definition: Independent Commission Against Corruption, Hong Kong (ICAC)
ICAC Independent Commission Against Corruption, Hong Kong
chief executive of Special Administrative Region (Hong Kong or Macao)/abbr. for 特別行政區首席執行官|特别行政区首席执行官
Sir Donald Tsang or Tsang Yam-Kuen (1944-)
abbr. for 民主建港協進聯盟|民主建港协进联盟, Democratic alliance for the betterment of Hong Kong (DAB), Hong Kong pro-Beijing party
Hong Kong Basic Law (in effect since the resumption of Chinese sovereignty in 1997)
Judicial Yuan, the high court under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
Leung Chun-ying (1954-), 3rd Chief Executive of Hong Kong
